New Records: Rachin Ravindra moved atop the scoring charts with 565 runs
Key Match Events: New Zealand dismissed Sri Lanka for 171
Trent Boult became the first New Zealander to collect 50 World Cup scalps
Rachin Ravindra took his tally to 565 runs
Mitchell Santner completed an exceptional spell of 10 straight overs
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand was uncertain about clinching their customary semifinal place due to injuries and defeats
The Black Caps had a full squad available for the match
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand will face India in the semifinals, a repeat of the epic two-day semifinal in 2019
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand finished the round robin with a 5-4 record and a net run rate healthy enough to all but lock down fourth on the ladder
India have romped past all eight opponents at their home tournament, appearing almost unbeatable
Others: Matt Henry's torn hamstring weakened a suddenly toothless attack
The Black Caps took five wickets in the powerplay, including five in the first 10 overs
Rachin Ravindra and Devon Conway shared an 86-run opening stand
Mitchell Santner and Lockie Ferguson applied middle-period pressure
